content:
# The extraction was successful! My inventory now accurately reflects 17 Copper Plates, along with the other materials I had previously.

# With these Copper Plates in hand, I can now proceed to craft additional items. 
# Given that I have enough Copper Plates, I can craft several useful components, such as Electronic Circuits, which require Copper Cables and Iron Plates.

# Each Electronic Circuit requires:
- 3 Copper Cables
- 1 Iron Plate

# Since I have 5 Iron Plates available, I can craft a few Electronic Circuits. 
# First, I will craft the necessary Copper Cables before crafting the Electronic Circuits.

# Let's craft 6 Copper Cables (which will require 3 Copper Plates).
if inspect_inventory()[Prototype.CopperPlate] >= 3:  # Check if I have enough Copper Plates.
    craft_item(Prototype.CopperCable, quantity=6)  # Crafting 6 Copper Cables.
else:
    print("Not enough Copper Plates to craft Copper Cables.")

# After crafting the Copper Cables, I will check my inventory to confirm the results.
print(f"Inventory after crafting Copper Cables: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Checking inventory after crafting.
